questions.question_text: What is a valid status of an endpoint attribute during the device registration process?

discussion.content: do not be confused by unknown the status unknown is before the device registration, this state is a device that do not have done the BYOD flow yet

Device Registration Status Endpoint Attribute
The state of the endpoint attribute DeviceRegistrationStatus changes during device registration to the following states.

Registered: The device has been through BYOD flow, and it is registered. There is a 20-minute delay before the attribute changes from pending to registered.

Pending: The device has been through BYOD flow, and it is registered. But, Cisco ISE has not seen it on the network.

Not Registered: The device has not been through BYOD flow. Not Registered is the default state of the DeviceRegistrationStatus attribute.

Stolen: The user logs onto the My Devices portal, and marks a currently onboarded device as Stolen.

questions.question_text: An administrator is configuring the Native Supplicant Profile to be used with the Cisco ISE posture agents and needs to test the connection using wired devices to determine which profile settings are available. Which two configuration settings should be used to accomplish this task? (Choose two.)

discussion.content:
That's fine:

Wired Profile
Allowed Protocol: Choose either PEAP or EAP-TLS.

Certificate Template: For TLS, choose one of the certificate templates. The certificate templates are defined in Administration > System Certificates > Certificate Authority > Certificate Templates.

Selected Answer: CE
Create a Native Supplicant Profile to be Used in Client-Provisioning Policy

You can create native supplicant profiles to enable users to bring personal devices to your Corporate network. Cisco ISE uses different policy rules for different operating systems. Each client provisioning policy rule contains a native supplicant profile, which specifies which provisioning wizard is to be used for which operating system.
Before you begin

 Configure the CA certificate template in Cisco ISE.

 Open up TCP port 8905 and UDP port 8905 to enable client agents and supplicant provisioning wizard installation. For more information about port usage, see the "Cisco ISE Appliance Ports Reference" appendix in the Cisco Identity Services Engine Hardware Installation Guide.

https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/td/docs/security/ise/2-6/admin_guide/b_ISE_26_admin_guide/b_ISE_admin_26_basic_setup.html?bookSearch=true#task_EC5F388E5EEF47F3B5EAA20E00C26B90

Selected Answer: CE
C, E is correct.

Selected Answer: CE
Wired Profile
Allowed Protocol: Choose either PEAP or EAP-TLS.

Certificate Template: For TLS, choose one of the certificate templates. The certificate templates are defined in Administration > System Certificates > Certificate Authority > Certificate Templates.

Selected Answer: CE
Provided answer is correct, look under Wired Profile: https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/td/docs/security/ise/2-4/admin_guide/b_ISE_admin_guide_24/m_configure_client_provisioning.html#ID1405
Provided answer is correct, look under Wired Profile: https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/td/docs/security/ise/2-4/admin_guide/b_ISE_admin_guide_24/m_configure_client_provisioning.html#ID1405

questions.question_text: Which Cisco ISE solution ensures endpoints have the latest version of antivirus updates installed before being allowed access to the corporate network?

An administrator is configuring posture assessment in Cisco ISE for the first time. Which two components must be uploaded to Cisco ISE to use Anyconnect for the agent configuration in a client provisioning policy? (Choose two.)

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: BE
. **AnyConnect Compliance Module:** This module is responsible for performing posture assessment on the endpoint device. The Compliance Module checks for specific installation status of software and files on the endpoint devices, and provides a pass/fail status based on the predefined posture rules provided by the administrator.

ðŸ‘‰ 2. **AnyConnect Agent Image:** This software package contains the necessary files required for the Cisco AnyConnect Secure Mobility Client to connect to a VPN server. This software package enables users to connect to the VPN server for secure access to corporate resources. Different versions of the AnyConnect agent image may be required depending on the operating systems and versions of the client devices accessing the VPN server.

Both of these components are required for posture assessment in Cisco ISE using AnyConnect agent configuration in a client provisioning policy

comments.content: The compliance module, also known as the Posture module, is not mandatory for configuring AnyConnect agent configuration in a client provisioning policy...

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: BE
First the anyconnect image and the compliance module needs to be uploaded.

questions.question_text: An engineer is unable to use SSH to connect to a switch after adding the required CLI commands to the device to enable TACACS+. The device administration license has been added to Cisco ISE, and the required policies have been created. Which action is needed to enable access to the switch?

comments.content: I agree. Thanks for the link.

Nope, you will not use tacacs for 802.1x authentication, only radius is used.
In this case only scenario here that we got it that the switch is configured, policy are done but the Network Device is not added to the list of devices so ISE cannot communicate via tacacs for validating the sessions for that specific NAD.
You can create policies without adding NAD in ISE. So it is a separate step.

discussion.content: I think it is B. The question indicates that the required policies have been created, that is, the switch has already been added to ISE. In addition, the TACACS+ commands have been configured, but it does not indicate anything about the SSH configuration.

choices.D: The switch needs to be added as a network device in Cisco ISE and set to use TACACS+.
choices.B: 802.1X authentication needs to be configured on the switch.
choices.A: The ip ssh source-interface command needs to be set on the switch
choices.C: The RSA keypair used for SSH must be regenerated after enabling TACACS+.
